doc:
Tote Du Crow https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tote_Du_Crow 0 Tote Du Crow (1858 – (1927-12-12)12 December 1927) was a Native American silent film actor originally from Watsonville, California. His brother was Dan Du Cote, who became a circus clown. As children, the pair ran away from their Watsonville, California, home to join the circus. Tote Du Crow also gained fame as a circus clown before he became an actor.Du Crow portrayed Bernardo in the silent Zorro films. Gene Sheldon later popularized this role for Disney in the late 1950s. He played 36 minor roles from 1915 until his death. His last film is The Blue Streak from 1926. Tote Du_Crow ( 1858 – ( 1927-12-12 ) 12_December_1927 ) was a_Native_American_silent_film_actor originally from Watsonville , California . His_brother was Dan_Du_Cote , who became a_circus_clown . As children , the_pair ran away from their_Watsonville_,_California_,_home to_join the_circus . Tote Du_Crow also gained fame as a_circus_clown before he became an_actor.Du_Crow portrayed Bernardo in the_silent_Zorro_films . Gene_Sheldon later popularized this_role for Disney in the_late_1950s . He played 36_minor_roles from 1915 until his_death . His_last_film is The_Blue_Streak from 1926 .
